text: I have to find whether any files that start with a certain string, say "auxfile", exist using Julia 1.5. The number of files to look for isn't large, so performance isn't an issue. What is the simplest way to achieve that?

elements.text: I have to find whether any files that start with a certain string, say "auxfile", exist using Julia 1.5. The number of files to look for isn't large, so performance isn't an issue. What is the simplest way to achieve that?

text:
Are the files in a specific folder that you know the location of?

If so, I think I would use `readdir()` to just list all the files/folders in the current directory or `walkdir(".")` to be able to recursively dive down into deeper folders to look for your files
